intro: Yucca gloriosa var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf yucca, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features tall, sword-shaped leaves that are bluish-green in color and often have a waxy coating. The plant produces striking, white, bell-shaped flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in panicles. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid climates, requiring minimal water and well-draining soil. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and drought tolerance in xeriscaped gardens.
